nodes.bodyText:
Trailing newline? I don't care, but some others do.
"below", "or higher", etc. are ambiguous terms for log levels.
Another common problem is very chatty loggers and the resulting system load just handling log messages.
It's not guaranteed that no plugins log credentials on INFO anyway.
Inconsistent terminology: Log recorder vs. logger.


  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            fine_warning=Creating a log recorder at FINE level or below may expose secrets in the logs. It is recommended that you delete the logger when you no longer need it.
          
          
            
            fine_warning=Loggers that record messages at FINE, FINER, or even FINEST can cause performance issues when many messages are being logged. Additionally, more verbose log levels increase the likelihood of credentials being logged. It is recommended that you delete such loggers, or update them to a less verbose level, when you no longer need them.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+fine_warning=Creating a log recorder at FINE level or below may expose secrets in the logs. It is recommended that you delete the logger when you no longer need it.

nodes.bodyText: Links from Jenkins to jenkins.io should always use URLs in redirect/ to be future-proof.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,9 +27,16 @@ THE SOFTWARE. --> - + +

${%Configure log recorder}
